episode_title: 501 - The One After Ross Says Rachel

content.description: Ross’s Wedding, continued from last season, the Minister is about to marry Ross and Emily.

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Friends. Family. We are gathered to celebrate here today the joyous union of Ross and Emily. (Time lapse) Now Ross, repeat after me. I Ross…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I Ross…

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Take thee, Emily…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Take thee, Rachel…(All his friends have looks of shock on their faces. He realizes what he said. Quickly he says.) Emily. (A slight chuckle.) Emily.

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Uhh…Shall I go on?
content.parenthetical: Looking and feeling awkward. he looks towards Emily.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He-he said Rachel, right? Do you think I should go up there?
content.parenthetical: To the woman sitting in front of her

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yes, yes, do go on.

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: I think we’d better start again. Ross, repeat after me. I, Ross…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I, Ross…

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Take thee, EM-I-LY …

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Take thee, (Glares at the Minister) Emily . (Chuckles) Like there’d be anybody else. (Emily is glaring at him.)

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, till death parts us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, until death parts us. Really, I do. Emily. (Points at her.)

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: May I have the rings? (He is given the rings) Emily, place this ring on Ross’s finger as a symbol of your bond everlasting. (She jams the ring onto his finger) Ross, place this ring in Emily’s hand as a symbol of the love that encircles you forever.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Happy too.

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Ross and Emily have made their declarations and it gives me great pleasure to declare them husband and wife.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yay!

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: You may kiss the bride.
(He goes to kiss her, but she isn’t very receptive of the kiss. She keeps avoiding him, until Ross finally gets to kiss her on her cheek.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: This is worse than when he married the lesbian.
(The band starts to play, and the recessional starts. Ross tries to take Emily’s hand, but she snatches it away from him.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Just keep smiling.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that went well. Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It could’ve been worse, he could’ve shot her.
(Ross and Emily make it to the lobby.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That uh, that was pretty funny. Wasn’t it?
(Emily gives him a forearm shot across the stomach.)

content.description: The Wedding reception, Ross and Emily are in the bathroom and Emily is yelling at him. Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are standing outside the doorway.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You’ve spoiled everything! It’s like a nightmare! My friends and family are out there! How can I face them?! How can you do this to me?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, no matter what happens with Ross and Emily, we still get cake right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That-that-that’s all right, no honey, you take your time sweetie. I’ll be right out here. (She slams the door in his face, to the gang) She’s just fixing her makeup.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I hate you!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And, I love you!! (He walks into the living room)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Boy, bad time to say the wrong name, huh Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s true, thanks dad. (To All) People should be dancing! Huh? Hey, this is a party! Come on! Joey, dance!! (He starts to dance but stops when no one else joins him.)
(Mrs. Waltham’s phone rings and she answers it.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Yes, Waltham interiors.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, hello, this is Ross Geller’s personal physician, Dr. Philange.
content.parenthetical: On the phone, in New York

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I’ve discovered that Ross forgot to take his brain medicine, uh, now without it, uh, in the brain of Ross, uh women’s names are interchangeable, through-through no fault of his own.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Oh my God, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, not Phoebe, Dr. Philange. Oh no! You have it too!
(Mrs. Waltham hangs up on her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello?
(Cut to Chandler and Monica at the buffet table.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh wow, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way but, I know we had plans to meet up tonight and, ugh, I’m just kinda worried about what it might do to our friendship.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. How could we have let this happen?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Seven times!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh! Well, y’know, we were away…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: In a foreign , romantic country…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I blame London.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bad London! (Takes a spoon and smacks the turkey.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So look umm, while we’re st-still in London, I mean, we can keep doing it right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I don’t see that we have a choice. But, when we’re back home, we don’t do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Only here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I saw a wine cellar downstairs…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll meet you there in two minutes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!
(He throws down his plate and runs to the wine cellar, Monica is about to follow him but is intercepted by Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon, honey, I gotta ask you something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross said my name up there, I mean, come on, I just can’t pretend that didn’t happen can I?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I-I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what should I do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just uh, do the right thing. (Uses some breath spray)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Toe the line. Thread the needle. Think outside the box! (Tries to leave, but is stopped by Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa, wait, listen, I think I’m just gonna talk to Ross about what he think it meant.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait. Rachel, no, he’s married. Married! If you don’t realize that, I can’t help you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you’re right. You’re right. You can’t help me.
(Cut to Mr. and Mrs. Geller.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Jack, is it all our fault? Were we bad parents?

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh yeah, well who serves steak when there’s no place to sit, I mean how are you supposed to eat this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what’s up? (He has solved the problem of eating the steak, he’s eating it with his hands.)
(Cut to Monica and Chandler, Monica is running up to him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where were you? We were supposed to meet in the wine cellar?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Forget it, that’s off.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: The next tour of the wine cellar will plan in two in-in minutes…
(Joey walks up to them.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, what are you doing? You promised Phoebe you wouldn’t eat meat until she has the babies!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I figured we’re in another country, so it doesn’t count.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s true.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The man’s got a point.
(Cut to Rachel and Ross.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. Sorry, things aren’t working out so well.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no! It could be better, but it’s gonna be okay, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah! Of course, I mean, she’s gonna get over this, y’know? I mean, so you said my name! Y’know you just said it ‘cause you saw me there, if you’d have seen a circus freak, you would’ve said, “I take thee circus freak.” Y’know, it didn’t mean anything, it’s just a mistake. It didn’t mean anything. Right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! Of course it didn’t mean anything! I mean, uh well, I can understand why Emily would think it meant something, y’know, because-because it was you…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But it absolutely didn’t. (Yelling towards the bathroom) It didn’t!! It didn’t!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, hey, the band’s ready outside for your first dance with Emily, so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Oh-oh, the band’s ready! Well, I-I-we gotta do what the band says—I don’t care about the stupid band!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You spit on me man! (Wipes his face.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Emily is kinda taking a long time, huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know when I locked myself in the bathroom at my wedding, it was because I was trying to pop the window out of the frame.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, right!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Get the hell out of there, y’know?
(They all start laughing, and quickly stop when they realize what she just said and run over to the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily? Emily? I’m coming in. (He opens the door to reveal that the window is gone, along with Emily.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, look at that, same thing.

content.description: [Scene: London Marriott, Monica and Chandler are walking to her room.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, in the middle of everything if I scream the word, “Yippee!” just ignore me.
(She laughs and opens the door to reveal Rachel sitting on the bed.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, Rachel! Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, hello Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross said my name. Okay? My name. Ross said my name up there that obviously means that he still loves me! (They both just stare at her.) Okay, don’t believe me, I know I’m right—do you guys want to go downstairs and get a drink?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, we do. But, we have to change first.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, I want to change. And why-why don’t you go down and get us a table?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we’ll be down in like five minutes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fifteen minutes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(The phone rings and Rachel answers it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello? Oh, Pheebs! (To them) It’s Phoebe!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yay…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, so what happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, Ross said my name.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I know, but I don’t think that means anything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Pheebs, y’know what, let’s look at this objectively all right? Ninth grade, right? The obsession starts. All right? The summer after ninth grade he sees me in a two-piece for the first time, his obsession begins to grow. So then…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, listen, why don’t we go change in my room?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But my clothes are—ohh! (They both leave.)
(Cut to Chandler’s room, he opens the door slowly to see if Joey is there and after seeing that he isn’t, ushers Monica into the room, closes the door, and the security bar.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, you look…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No time for that!
(They both start to frantically rip each other’s clothes off, but are interrupted when Joey tries to open the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, dude, let me in. I got a girl out here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’ve got a girl in here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No you don’t, I just saw you go in there with Monica!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we’re-we’re hanging out in here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, which one of us is gonna be having sex in there, me or you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I suppose I’d have to say you!! But, what if we’re watching a movie in here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Which we are, and-and we already paid for it. It’s My Giant !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My Giant ? I love that movie!

content.description: Ross and Emily’s room, Chandler and Monica are still looking for a place to do the deed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You really think this is okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, Ross and Emily aren’t gonna use it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, it’s so beautiful. Ohh! Y’know, I-I don’t know if I feel right about this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh Mon-Mon-Mon-Mon-look, this is the honeymoon suite. The room expects sex. The room would be disappointed if it didn’t get sex. All of the other honeymoon suites would think it was a loser.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!
(They both run to rip the covers off the bed, but are interrupted by Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope, not under here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You didn’t find her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I’ve looked everywhere!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you couldn’t have looked everywhere or else you would’ve found her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I think you should keep looking!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, for about 30 minutes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or 45.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, in 45 minutes you can find her twice. (Monica smiles at that.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! For all I know, she’s trying to find me but couldn’t because I kept moving around. No, from now on, I’m staying in one place. (He sits down on the bed.) Right here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it’s getting late.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we’re gonna go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually, do you guys mind staying here for a while?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh, y’know, umm we gotta get up early and catch that plane for New York.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it’s a very large plane.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s cool.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But, we’ll stay here with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks guys! (They both sit down on either side of him.) I really appreciate this, y’know, but you don’t have to rub my butt.
(Chandler slowly takes his hand away.)

content.description: Ross and Emily’s room, the next morning. Ross is now asleep and has his head in Monica’s lap and his feet on Chandler’s lap. Monica and Chandler are both still awake and depressed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We have to leave for New York in an hour.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, I’ve been looking at those doors, they look pretty sound proof, don’t you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We can’t do that that’s insane. I mean ‘A’ he could wake up and ‘B’ y’know, let’s go for it.
(They both try to slowly extricate themselves from Ross, but there’s a knock on the door that awakens him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Em-Emily? (Looking around for her.) Em-Emily? (He runs to the door.) Emily! (He opens the door to reveal the Walthams standing outside.)

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: You can forget about Emily, she’s not with us.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: We’ve come for her things.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait, well wh-wh-wh-where is she?

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: She’s in hiding. She’s utterly humiliated. She doesn’t want to see you ever again.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: We’re very sad that it didn’t work out between you and Emily, monkey. But, I think you’re absolutely delicious.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Excuse me, I’m standing right here!

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Oh yes, there you are.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey-hey, you guys oh hurry up, get some, there’s a whole cart outside… (Sees the Walthams and stops.)
content.parenthetical: entering, carrying an armful of those little soaps.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Goodbye Geller.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now, hold on! Hold on! (Stops him) Look, look, your daughter and I are supposed to leave tonight for our honeymoon, now-now you-you tell her that I’m gonna be at that airport and I hope that she’ll be there too! Oh yeah, I said Rachel’s name, but it didn’t mean anything, Okay? She’s-she’s just a friend and that’s all! (Rachel sits down, depressed.) That’s all! Now just tell Emily that I love her and that I can’t imagine spending my life with anyone else. Please, promise me that you’ll tell her that.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: All right, I’ll tell her. (To his wife) Come on bugger face!

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Call me.
content.parenthetical: As she walks pass Ross, she pats his but.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: You spend half your life in the bathroom, why don’t you ever go out the bloody window!

content.description: A 747 somewhere over the North Atlantic, Monica and Chandler are sitting in first class, depressed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, maybe it’s best that we never got to do it again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it kinda makes that-that one night special. (Realizes something) Y’know, technically we still are over international waters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna go to the bathroom, maybe I’ll see you there in a bit?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘Kay!
(Monica gets up and heads for the bathroom, Chandler turns to watch her go and is startled to see Joey sitting in Monica’s seat.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can I ask you something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Felicity and I, we’re watching My Giant , and I was thinking, “I’m never gonna be as good an actor as that giant.” Do you think I’m just wasting my life with this acting thing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I mean, the giant is like five years younger than me, y’know, you think I’ll ever get there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay man. (Chandler starts to get up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But what about how much taller he is than me?
(Time lapse, Chandler is finishing his third little bottle of booze.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I mean, there’s no way I can make myself taller now, y’know? And who knows what science will come up with in the future, but Chandler, what if I die an unsuccessful, regular sized man?
(Monica returns.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Monica, wow you’ve been in the bathroom for like a half-hour.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Had the beef-tips, huh?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is eating cereal from a bowl she has balanced on her stomach as Joey, Chandler, and Monica return.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!
(They all hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You ate meat! (Joey is shocked) (To Chandler and Monica) You had sex! (They’re shocked.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No we didn’t!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know you didn’t, I was talking about Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, I did not have sex.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This pregnancy is throwing me all off.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’m gonna go say hi the chick and the duck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, me too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why would you need to say hi to them, you’ve been feeding them for four days?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh right, maybe I’ll just go home.
(She grabs her bag and leaves, Joey moves a little quicker to his apartment, leaving Monica and Chandler alone.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we certainly are alone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Good thing we have that, ‘Not in New York’ rule.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Right. Umm, listen since we’re-we-re on that subject, umm, I just wanted to tell you that uh, well, I-I was going through a really hard time in London, what with my brother getting married and that guy thinking I was Ross’s mother…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, an-anyway, I just—that night meant a lot to me, I guess I’m just trying to say thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. Y’know, that night meant a lot to me too, and it wasn’t because I was in a bad place or anything, it just meant a lot to me ‘cause, you’re really hot! Is that okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I’m cute too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And you’re cute too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you! (They hug.) All right, I gotta go unpack.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye.
(After he closes the door, Monica starts to follow him, but thinks better of it and stops.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m still on London time, does that count?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That counts!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, good! (They start kissing.)

content.description: An airport in London, Ross is waiting for Emily to show up to go on their honeymoon and sees Rachel walking past.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach! Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! What are you, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I-I’ve been on Standby for a flight home for hours.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, so no sign of Emily huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So umm, what time are you supposed to leave?

content.speaker: Gate Agent
content.text: This is the last call for Flight 1066 to Athens. The last call.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pretty soon I guess.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just, I don’t understand, I mean, how-how can she do this? Y’know, what, am I, am I like a complete idiot for thinking that she’d actually show up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you’re not an idiot, Ross. You’re a guy very much in love.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Same difference.

content.speaker: Gate Agent
content.text: All ticketed passengers for Flight 1066 to Athens should now be on board.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I get it! Well, that’s that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you know what, I think you should go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I do. I think you should go, by yourself, get some distance, clear your head, I think it’d be really good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I don’t, I don’t, I don’t know…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on Ross! I think it would be really good for you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I could, yeah, I can do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t, I can’t even believe her! No, y’know what, I am, I am gonna go!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know—thanks! (They hug)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you back at home, if I ever get a flight out of here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well…nah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Wait, what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why don’t you come, I mean, I-I have two tickets, why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well-well, I don’t know Ross—really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah, it’ll be great! You can, you can lay on the beach and I can cry over my failed marriage. See-see how I make jokes?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No really, I mean, I mean, God, I could use a friend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow, uh okay, uh maybe. Umm, yes, I can do that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cool!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on! (They go to the jetway, Ross hands the tickets to the gate agent.) Here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay, we’re going. Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah! Ah! I forgot my jacket!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wait-wait-wait…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You tell them to wait!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Wait! Wait!
(Ross retrieves his jacket and sees that not only has Emily arrived, but she as seen Rachel take her place on the plane.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily.
(She stares at him and Ross realizes what she’s thinking.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no-no-no! Oh-no! (Emily starts to run out and Ross chases her.) No! No! Emily!

content.description: Flight 1066 to Athens, Rachel is ordering a drink for Ross and herself.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh, yes, I will have a glass of the Merlot and uh, (points to Ross’s seat.) he will have a white wine spritzer. Woo! (Looks out the window.) Hey, look at that, the airport’s moving. (Realizes that that’s not how it works.) Hey, are we moving?! Are we moving? Why are we moving? Hey, time-out, umm, yeah, does the captain know that we’re moving? (Sits back in defeat.) Oh my God. Oh, my gosh.
